com.milk.uberchat.base
Class BaseIdentity

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseLocus
              |
              +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseChannelHolder
                    |
                    +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseIdentity
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatChannelHolder, ChatEntity, ChatIdentity, ChatLocus, Commandable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ICBIdentity, IRCIdentity, SBIdentity
public abstract class BaseIdentity
extends BaseChannelHolder
implements ChatIdentity

This is an abstract base class that provides a lot of what all ChatIdentity implementors need.

Note that BaseIdentity completely takes care of setting the description for its ChatEntity nature, so subclasses should not call BaseEntity.setDescription(). Unfortunately, Java doesn't provide a way to specify this restriction programatically. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

uberBroadcast

protected void uberBroadcast(BaseEvent event)

Broadcast an event to the appropriate uber-listeners of this entity. BaseIdentity uses this to send the event to its parent system.

To repeat the note from BaseEntity: Subclasses may override this to send to additional listeners or perform needed actions, but overriding methods must call super.uberBroadcast(). Java has no way to enforce this, however. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Overrides:
uberBroadcast in class BaseEntity
Parameters:
event - the event to send

channelRemoved

protected void channelRemoved(ChatChannel channel)
BaseChannelHolder calls this method when a channel has been removed. We use this to make sure that the identity is not joined with the channel, since it shouldn't end up joined with a non-existent channel. We also use this to inform the channel that it has no users in it, since if the channel doesn't exist on an identity, then it had better not have any users lurking around! The notification can only work, though, if the given channel is in fact a BaseLocus of some sort.

Overrides:
channelRemoved in class BaseChannelHolder
Parameters:
channel - the channel that was removed

userRemoved

protected void userRemoved(ChatUser user)
BaseLocus calls this method when a user has been removed. We use this to make sure that the user isn't in any channels, but we can only do this if the user is in fact a BaseChannelHolder.

Overrides:
userRemoved in class BaseLocus
Parameters:
user - the user that was removed

nameChanged

protected void nameChanged()
BaseEntity calls this when the name and/or canonical name of this object changes. We use this to re-make the description, since it is in part based on the name.

Overrides:
nameChanged in class BaseEntity

identityMakeChannel

protected abstract ChatChannel identityMakeChannel(java.lang.String name)
BaseIdentity calls this when a client has requested a channel by name, but it doesn't exist in its list of known channels. The subclass should either make the channel or return null. It should not call addChannel(); BaseIdentity will do that for you.

Parameters:
name - the name of the channel to make
Returns:
null-ok; the channel made, or null if it wasn't made

identityMakeUser

protected abstract ChatUser identityMakeUser(java.lang.String name)
BaseIdentity calls this when a client has requested a user by name, but it doesn't exist in its list of known users. The subclass should either make the user or return null. It should not call addUser(); BaseIdentity will do that for you.

Parameters:
name - the name of the user to make
Returns:
null-ok; the user made, or null if it wasn't made

identityGetIdentityUser

protected abstract ChatUser identityGetIdentityUser()
BaseIdentity calls this exactly once, the first time a client asks for the identity user for this identity.

Returns:
the identity user for this identity

identityAdded

protected final void identityAdded()
Inform this BaseIdentity that it has been added to the system it is associated with. If the system is in fact a BaseSystem, then it will call this method itself, when appropriate. If not, it is up to the subclass to call this when appropriate.

identityRemoved

protected final void identityRemoved()
Inform this BaseIdentity that it has been removed from the system it is associated with. If the system is in fact a BaseSystem, then it will call this method itself, when appropriate. If not, it is up to the subclass to call this when appropriate.

makeDescription

private static java.lang.String makeDescription(java.lang.String name,
                                                ChatSystem system)
Create a description for this identity.

Parameters:
name - the name for this identity
system - the target system for this identity
